{{Sidebar("html/reference/elements")}}{{deprecated_header}} The **``** [HTML](/blog/Web/HTML) deprecated element renders the enclosed text at a font size one level larger than the surrounding text (`medium` becomes `large`, for example). The size is capped at the browser's maximum permitted font size. > [!WARNING] > This element has been removed from the specification and shouldn't be used anymore. Use the CSS {{cssxref("font-size")}} property to adjust the font size. ## Attributes This element has no other attributes than the [global attributes](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes), common to all elements. ## Examples Here we see examples showing the use of `` followed by an example showing how to accomplish the same results using modern CSS syntax instead. ### Using big This example uses the obsolete `` element to increase the size of some text. #### HTML ```html

``` #### Result {{EmbedLiveSample("Using_big", 640, 60)}} ### Using CSS `font-size` This example uses the CSS {{cssxref("font-size")}} property to increase the font size by one level. #### CSS ```css .bigger { font-size: larger; } ``` #### HTML ```html
